Colin Farrell bo morda Pingvin v novem Batmanu
07 Nov 2019, 08:55 by STA

Zvezdniški zasedbi, ki bo nastopila v novem filmu The Batman v režiji Matta Reevesa, se bo morebiti pridružil tudi Colin Farrell. Spletni portal Deadline poroča, da pri Warner Brosu snubijo irskega igralca za vlogo Pingvina. Leta 1992 je Pingvina v filmu Batmanova vrnitev v režiji Tima Burtona igral Danny DeVito.



Zvezdniški zasedbi, ki bo nastopila v novem filmu The Batman v režiji Matta Reevesa, se bo morebiti pridružil tudi Colin Farrell.  Foto: Andraž Gombač

LOS ANGELES > Farrell je nazadnje igral v Disneyjevem filmu Dumbo, prihodnje leto pa ga bo mogoče ob boku Matthewa McConaugheyja gledati v novem filmu Guyja Ritchieja The Gentlemen in pa v znanstveno-fantastični drami After Yang v režiji Kogonade. Preizkusil se je že v vlogi stripovskega junaka, in sicer kot Bullseye v Daredevilu Marka Stevena Johnsona iz leta 2003.
V vlogi priljubljenega stripovskega junaka bo v The Barman nastopil Robert Pattinson. Britanski igralec je za New York Times o liku Batmana dejal, da je njegova moralnost nekoliko vprašljiva ter da v nasprotju z drugimi stripovskimi junaki nikakor ni zlat fant. "Njegov pogled na svet je po svoje preprost, a njegova lega je čudna, kar omogoča večji razpon pri oblikovanju lika," je pojasnil.
Poleg Pattinsona bodo v filmu nastopili tudi Zoe Kravitz v vlogi Catwoman, Paul Dano kot Ugankar in Jeffrey Wright kot komisar Gordon. Kot piše The Guardian, so v torek naznanili še, da igralca Andyja Serkisa snubijo za vlogo Alfreda Pennywortha, butlerja Bruce Wayna, ki ga je v trilogiji o Batmanu Christopherja Nolana igral Michael Caine.
Režiser filma Reeves je v začetku leta za Hollywood Reporter dejal, da je pri Batmanu navdušujoče, kako aktualen je in kako osebno ga je mogoče jemati. Glede filma je razkril, da prinaša temačno zgodbo, za katero upa, da bo navdihujoča in hkrati čustvena.
Produkcija filma The Batman se bo začela predvidoma konec tega oziroma v začetku prihodnjega leta, film pa bo prišel v kina leta 2021.
text:
Colin Farrell may be the Penguin in the new Batman
07 Nov 2019, 08:55 by STA

The star-studded cast, which will star in Matt Reeves' new movie The Batman, may also be joined by Colin Farrell. Deadline reports that Warner Bros. is slamming an Irish actor for the Penguin role. In 1992, the Penguin was played by Tim Burton in the film Batman's Return, directed by Tim Burton.



The star-studded cast, which will star in Matt Reeves' new movie The Batman, may also be joined by Colin Farrell. Photo: Andraž Gombač

LOS ANGELES> Farrell last starred in the Disney movie Dumbo, and next year he will be able to watch Matthew McConaughey's side in Guy Ritchie's new movie The Gentlemen and in the sci-fi drama After Yang directed by Kogonade. He has already tested himself as a comic book hero, like Bullseye in Mark Steven Johnson's 2003 Daredevil.
The role of the popular comic book hero will feature Robert Pattinson in The Barman. The British actor told the New York Times about Batman's character that his morality is somewhat questionable and that he is by no means a golden boy, unlike other comic book characters. "His worldview is simple in its own right, but its position is strange, allowing for more range in character design," he explained.
In addition to Pattinson, Zoe Kravitz will star in Catwoman, Paul Dano as Ugankar and Jeffrey Wright as Commissioner Gordon. According to The Guardian, they announced on Tuesday that they are casting actor Andy Serkis for the role of Alfred Pennyworth, the Bruce Wayne butler played by Michael Caine in Christopher Nolan's Batman trilogy.
At the beginning of the year, the filmmaker Reeves told the Hollywood Reporter that Batman was impressed by how up-to-date he was and how personally he could be taken. As for the movie, he revealed that he is delivering a dark story that he hopes will be inspiring and at the same time emotional.
Production of The Batman is set to begin later this year or early next year, with the movie set to hit theaters in 2021.
